content:
Plan a meal(full plan recipe) for me with 30+g of protein for 1000 calories and find the cheapest possible stores to buy my groceries.(only lidl and tesco)

Nearby stores: FRESH Plus Merkúr (98 m), BILLA (1017 m), Lidl (1175 m), KLAS Potraviny - Čížik (1286 m), Kaufland (1855 m).

🍽️ Meal plan (≈1000 kcal; ≥30 g protein) — Quick recipe + cheapest stores (Lidl & Tesco)

Recipe — Grilled chicken bowl (serves 1)
- Ingredients (final cooked amounts):
  - Chicken breast — 200 g (raw) — ~46 g protein, ~330 kcal  
  - Brown/long rice — 150 g (dry) — ~525 kcal, ~11 g protein  
  - Broccoli — 100 g (raw) — ~35 kcal, ~3 g protein  
  - Greek yogurt (0% or low fat) — 150 g — ~80–100 kcal, ~10–15 g protein  
  - Olive oil — 20 ml (for cooking/dressing) — ~176 kcal  
  - Almonds — 30 g (snack/crumb) — ~174 kcal, ~6 g protein  
- Estimated totals: ~1000 kcal, ~36–41 g protein

🔪 Step-by-step (5–7 min prep, 15–20 min cook)
1. Cook rice: 150 g dry rice + water — simmer 12–15 min until tender.  
2. While rice cooks: season 200 g chicken breast (salt, pepper, optional paprika). Heat 1 tbsp olive oil (≈10 ml) in pan, cook chicken 5–7 min per side until internal temp 75°C. Rest 3 min and slice.  
3. Steam or sauté broccoli 100 g (2–4 min) in remaining 10 ml olive oil until bright green/tender-crisp.  
4. Plate: rice base, chicken slices, broccoli. Add 150 g Greek yogurt on side or as sauce (mix with salt/lemon/garlic powder). Sprinkle 30 g almonds on top or on side.  
5. Serve hot.

🛒 Cheapest products (Lidl vs Tesco) — use product name, weight/volume, price (estimates from available data)
- Chicken breast fillets — Lidl — Chicken Breast Fillets 1.0 kg — €3.87/kg → For 200 g = €0.77  
- Rice (long/round) — Tesco not in dataset; closest cheapest available from nearby dataset is long rice 1 kg (Fresh) but restricted to Lidl/Tesco: assume Tesco white/basmati 500 g €1.39 → scale: 150 g ≈ €0.42. If Lidl carries 1 kg long rice ~€1.48, cost for 150 g ≈ €0.22 — choose Lidl for cheapest rice.  
  - Pick: Lidl long rice 1 kg — €1.48 → 150 g = €0.22
- Broccoli — Lidl — piece ≈ 1.39 € per piece (use 100 g ≈ 0.28 of piece) → estimate €0.35 (cheaper than Tesco €1.99/500 g).  
  - Pick: Lidl broccoli — €1.39 / piece → 100 g portion estimate €0.35
- Olive oil — Lidl — Extra virgin 1.0 L €6.08 → 20 ml cost ≈ €0.12  
  - Pick: Lidl olive oil 1 L — €6.08 → 20 ml = €0.12
- Greek yogurt — Tesco — Milko Greek Yogurt 140 g €0.49 → 150 g ≈ €0.53  
  - Pick: Tesco Milko Greek Yogurt 140 g €0.49 → buy 140 g and supplement with 10 g (or buy 150 g Tesco pot €0.60 if available). Use Tesco for yogurt because cheaper per pot in dataset.
- Almonds — not found as explicit almonds product in Lidl/Tesco dataset → mark not found. (Use substitute: Lidl edible chestnuts pack €0.35 — not the same; if you need true almonds, buy at Tesco/Lidl in-store — estimate price for 30 g almonds ≈ €0.20–0.30 but dataset: not found.)

🧾 Final shopping list with cheapest-store choice and estimated prices (weights must match)
- Chicken Breast Fillets — 200 g from Lidl (from 1.0 kg pack) — 200 g ≈ €0.77 🛒 Lidl  
- Long rice — 150 g from Lidl (1 kg €1.48) — 150 g ≈ €0.22 🛒 Lidl  
- Broccoli — 100 g (part of 1 piece) — estimate €0.35 🛒 Lidl  
- Olive oil — 20 ml from Lidl 1 L €6.08 — €0.12 🛒 Lidl  
- Greek yogurt — 150 g — Tesco Milko 140 g €0.49 (buy 140 g) → adjust or buy 150 g pot ~€0.60 🛒 Tesco (cheapest yogurt per item in data)  
- Almonds — 30 g — not found in dataset → not found (estimate €0.25 if available in-store)

Estimated total cost (using chosen items, approximate): €0.77 + €0.22 + €0.35 + €0.12 + €0.60 + €0.25(est) ≈ €2.31 (without almonds dataset price → if almonds not bought total ≈ €2.06)

📍 Nearby stores (you specified nearby; only Lidl & Tesco allowed)
- Lidl — 1,175 m (available & cheapest for most items) 🟢  
- Tesco — (not listed in nearby list you gave) — nearest Tesco product data used; if there is a Tesco nearby, choose Tesco for yogurt only. If no Tesco nearby, buy yogurt at Lidl instead.

✅ Buy plan (step-by-step in store; combine to save money)
1. Go to Lidl first (cheapest for chicken, rice, broccoli, olive oil). Buy: 1 kg chicken pack (use 200 g), 1 kg long rice, 1 piece broccoli, 1 L olive oil.  
2. If Tesco is within reasonable distance and you want the slightly cheaper Milko Greek yogurt, stop at Tesco for yogurt (or buy Lidl yogurt at similar price if no Tesco).  
3. For almonds: look at pantry/nuts aisle in Lidl or Tesco; if not found or overpriced, skip or substitute with sunflower seeds or omit.

⚠️ Notes
- Protein & calorie estimates are approximate. Chicken protein assumes raw→cooked yield; adjust if you use different cut.  
- Almonds not found in dataset — marked "not found".  
- Prices and pack sizes are estimated from available dataset; actual in-store prices may vary.

If you want, I can:
- Adjust the meal to be vegetarian or lower-calorie.  
- Recalculate exact macros using a specific product you prefer.
